anyactions.common.procedure.local.check_local_tool_auth_method(api_dir_path, tool_name, observer=False)¶

Currently, check if the tool needs api key

Returns:

0 if no api_key parameter

1 if api_key is required 2 if api_key is optional

Return type:

int

anyactions.common.procedure.local.check_local_tool_exists(api_dir_path, tool_name, observer=False)¶

Check if local tool exists

anyactions.common.procedure.local.check_local_tool_legit(api_dir_path, tool_name, observer=False)¶

Check if local tools directory exists and with api keys

anyactions.common.procedure.local.check_local_tools_dir_exists(api_dir_path, observer=False)¶

Check if local tools directory exists

anyactions.common.procedure.local.check_tool_decorator(tool_function, target_decorator, observer=False)¶

Check if a tool function has specific decorators.

Parameters:

  • tool_function (Callable[..., Any]) – The function to check for decorators

  • target_decorator (str) – The decorator name to check for

  • observer – Flag to enable logging, defaults to False

Returns:

Dictionary containing decorator information with the following keys:

  • has_decorators: bool indicating if any decorators are present

  • decorators: list of decorator names

  • original_function: name of the original function

Return type:

dict

anyactions.common.procedure.local.create_local_tools_dir(api_dir_path, observer=False)¶

Create local directory for storing tools

anyactions.common.procedure.local.function_to_json(func, skip_api_key=True)¶

https://github.com/openai/swarm?tab=readme-ov-file#examples

Converts a Python function into a JSON-serializable dictionary that describes the function’s signature, including its name, description, and parameters.

Parameters:

func (Callable) – The function to be converted.

Return type:

dict

Returns:

A dictionary representing the function’s signature in JSON format.

anyactions.common.procedure.local.read_tool_definition(api_dir_path, tool_name)¶

Parses the _tool_definition_ from the specified Python file based on AnyActions schema.

Parameters:

  • api_dir_path (Path) – The path to the local environment directory.

  • tool_name (str) – The name of the tool file (e.g., ‘tool_function.py’).

Returns:

The parsed tool definition.

Return type:

dict

anyactions.common.procedure.local.validate_local_tool(api_dir_path, tool_name, observer=False)¶

Validate the usable status of a tool

anyactions.common.procedure.local.write_local_tool(api_dir_path, tool_definition, tool_func, exec_sh=None)¶

Write tool function to local environment. Might execute shell commands in the future.

Parameters:

  • api_dir_path (str) – Path to the directory storing API configurations and tools.

  • tool_definition (dict) – Tool definition in OpenAI format.

  • tool_func (str) – Function code as a string.

  • exec_sh (str, optional) – Shell commands to execute. Defaults to None.

Return type:

None
